task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 39°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its full vertical extent; pitching up will reveal the roofline which is likely not visible at pitch 0°.
To estimate the building's height, I need to see both the base and roof; pitching down from 30°UP will reveal the ground level for vertical span measurement.
I need to reorient to face the target building at 39°NE (current heading 0°N) while adjusting pitch to neutral (0°) to prepare for vertical measurement.
I've adjusted pitch to see both roof (30°UP) and ground level (30°DOWN) in prior steps; combining vertical angle span with estimated distance of ~10m suggests a height of approximately 20 meters.
